intro: Covellia rufescens, commonly known as the red-stemmed bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its tubular, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are distinctly reddish in color. Covellia rufescens is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and mountain slopes.
